author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  This seems to be the agenda, though since a lot of people are recovering, it might just be a simple catch-up re devcon and moving forward (re @kzg_ceremony_bot: <Chiali> hi guys, what do you guys think we do a team sync up and ideation meeting?
I think the next bi-weekly is 10/27, we can move it earlier? or you guys can arrange in person one if you all are in bogota.
I was thinking to use figjam for whiteboarding, can talk about:
- improvement and remaining features from current build
- dashboard
- records

lastly, if time allows we can chat about the ending ceremony & poap.

it will be good to do a short post mortem as well.)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<kevaundray> Meeting ended early. Since quite a few people were missing, I'll summarise. 

(Call was recorded, let me know who I should send it to)

From the progress update: 

- Marcin: Double signing has been added using blst. Arkworks is not there as there is no hash_to_curve. Kev to send the link to the hash_to_curve impl for arkworks as its hidden in a test crate.

- Greg: Ensured OpenAPI matches the specs now, also looking to add error codes so that clients can have a more fine-grained context on what happened.

- Geoff, Chiali, Takamichi, Nicolas : Added double signing, but its using the javascript impl, so looking to switch to the one being used in the rust sequencer crypto code.

- Kev: Pushed impl of CLI at devcon. Need to improve developer UX of it. Slow contribution times were because we were building in debug mode.

- Nicolas: Noteed that Trent and himself were being stuck in the lobby. Marcin tested in live and it worked fine. Would be good to have better debugging tools to figure out what is happening. Kev noted that remco was looking into this


---------

Main question asked in the call that I think we should consolidate is "What is the current timeline?"

I made a comment re one month, which seemed tenable from the current progress of those on the call, but noted that I needed to speak with Trent/Carl/Remco to see if I'm missing anything.

author: bridge-bot
content: <kevaundray> Marcin here is the link to the arkworks hashing code, its quite obscure unfortunately: https://github.com/arkworks-rs/algebra/blob/master/ec/src/hashing/tests/suites.rs#L87

author: bridge-bot
content: <Marcin> > <Marcin>  thanks! (re @kevaundray: Marcin here is the link to the arkworks hashing code, its quite obscure unfortunately: https://github.com/arkworks-rs/algebra/blob/master/ec/src/hashing/tests/suites.rs#L87)

content:

From the progress update: 

- Marcin: Double signing has been added using blst. Arkworks is not there as there is no hash_to_curve. Kev to send the link to the hash_to_curve impl for arkworks as its hidden in a test crate.

- Greg: Ensured OpenAPI matches the specs now, also looking to add error codes so that clients can have a more fine-grained context on what happened.

- Geoff, Chiali, Takamichi, Nicolas : Added double signing, but its using the javascript impl, so looking to switch to the one being used in the rust sequencer crypto code.

- Kev: Pushed impl of CLI at devcon. Need to improve developer UX of it. Slow contribution times were because we were building in debug mode.

- Nicolas: Noteed that Trent and himself were being stuck in the lobby. Marcin tested in live and it worked fine. Would be good to have better debugging tools to figure out what is happening. Kev noted that remco was looking into this


---------

Main question asked in the call that I think we should consolidate is "What is the current timeline?"

I made a comment re one month, which seemed tenable from the current progress of those on the call, but noted that I needed to speak with Trent/Carl/Remco to see if I'm missing anything.)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<trent_vanepps> 1 month timeline seems accurate:

- prep for audit starting nov 7, tighten/finalize sequencer code before then.
- finalize flow (we removed some steps last week)
- fix interface issues (i will leave issues for the ones i see today)
- make interface responsive for as many device X browser combinations as possible, try to get i18n (or close to it)
- start doing twitter spaces to boost awareness
